channel.title: Web3 Security Paper Digest
channel.description: Curated papers on Web3, blockchain, and smart contract security from ArXiv and ACL

item.title: SCALM: Detecting Bad Practices in Smart Contracts Through LLMs
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces SCALM, an LLM-based framework (using Step-Back Prompting + RAG) to detect and address over 35 bad practices in Ethereum smart contracts.
  • Performs a systematic study of bad coding practices that increase risk (even if not directly exploitable vulnerabilities) and builds detection capabilities around them.
  • Evaluates SCALM across multiple LLMs and datasets, reporting that it outperforms existing tools for detecting such bad practices.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Zongwei Li', 'Xiaoqi Li', 'Wenkai Li', 'Xin Wang']
  • Tags: ['smart-contract-security', 'vulnerability-detection', 'LLM-auditing', 'bad-practices']

item.title: TxRay: Agentic Postmortem of Live Blockchain Attacks
item.description:
Summary

  • TxRay is an LLM-based agentic postmortem system that, from one or more seed transactions, reconstructs Anyone-Can-Take (ACT) DeFi attacks, derives evidence-backed root causes, and generates runnable, self-contained Proofs of Concept (PoCs) with executable semantic oracles.
  • TxRay self-checks postmortems and encodes incident-specific assertions; PoCEvaluator is an independent agentic execution-and-review tool used to validate PoC correctness and quality.
  • Evaluation on 114 incidents reports 92.11% end-to-end reproduction, 98.1% of PoCs avoid hard-coding attacker addresses, and median latencies of 40 minutes for root causes and 59 minutes for PoCs; TxRay improves coverage over prior tools (STING, APE).

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ziyue Wang', 'Jiangshan Yu', 'Kaihua Qin', 'Dawn Song', 'Arthur Gervais', 'Liyi Zhou']
  • Tags: ['smart-contract-exploits', 'DeFi', 'postmortem-analysis', 'PoC-generation', 'LLM-agents']
